title: Okay, I'm not HUGE into the lore, but even I think Ekko's lore is disappointing.
body:
TL;DR: Ekko lore verdict: I'm disappointed.

Be forewarned, I may be in complete ignorance since I haven't kept up with the way lore has been delivered lately. These are just my random thoughts.

> A prodigy from the rough streets of Zaun, Ekko manipulates time to spin any situation to his advantage. Using his own invention, the Zero-Drive, he explores the branching possibilities of reality. As well as experimenting with multi-dimensional probability, Ekko spends his days running wild with the other lost children of Zaun. Though he revels in this freedom, when there's a threat to his friends, he'll endure anything to defend them. To the unknowing observer, Ekko accomplishes the impossible with ease, time and time again.

I'm not huge into lore, I don't really keep up with it, and I don't know a lot of the story. I casually read pages of lore to see how my favourite champion fits into the story, and that's about it. I would assume the majority of players fall into this category, with a select few who know zero about lore and a select few who keep up with it extensively.

**From an average player, excited to learn the background of a character in which I was genuinely interested, I feel disappointed.**

I'm not hating on Riot. They've done great stories, great lore in the past. But this, this is just... sad, almost.

Let me sum up what my thoughts were after the cinematic:

1. Who is Ekko?
2. What is his story?
3. Why is he fighting?
4. Why did the memorial breaking upset him so much?
5. What's the story behind his invention?

Allow me to now interpret Ekko's lore in what we call ** layman's terms, the simplest  and most straightforward, simple, zero-depth way to explain something.**

> Ekko manipulates time to spin any situation to his advantage.

* He travels in time to turn any situation in his favour.

Too bad this is nearly word-for-word what hte lore says.

> Using his own invention, the Zero-Drive, he explores the branching possibilities of reality. 

* He invented the Zero-Drive.

Cool. Why? Where did this idea come from? I don't understand. I thought there'd be more to this device than simply "kid invented it."

> Ekko spends his days running wild with the other lost children of Zaun.

* He plays with his friends.

> Though he revels in this freedom, when there's a threat to his friends, he'll endure anything to defend them. 

* He exercises basic human decency by helping friends in need.
* He'd catch a grenade for ya, throw his hand on a blade for ya, and jump in front of a train for ya.

Who cares? Most people would stand up for their friends (unless they have crappy friends).

So out of what I consider to be the 5 biggest questions that come out of his trailer alone, a whopping 0 were answered. Why not? I don't understand.

I'm not huge into the debacle between Caitlyn, Vi and Zaun. I enjoy hearing the big picture, but I haven't done extensive reading into those places, but I can definitely imagine that people who DO invest their time into those cases have a plethora of other questions that, unfortunately, will be unanswered.

Basically, what I'm trying to say is something like this. I love Swain. When I read his little blurb, it doesn't dive into details, and it doesn't really tell a ton about his background. But the blurb is surrounded in mystery and invites you to want to learn more about his person. Ekko's just... doesn't to me.

I dunno. Call me a fool.

To kinda expand on what's happening so you're in the know, Roit decided to change their approach to writing and displaying lore, which led to them making these short blurbs, by short blurbs I mean the single paragraph bios like Ekko's here. The intention was for lore to be put on the website and for the client to have this small blurb with a link to more lore on that champion including longer stories and whatever else they have in store.

Problem is the website's broken as shit! Even now you can actually go to the champion pages and visually see where things are broken. They've been working on a fix and are committed to this change since it's been 9 months since these problems reared their ugly heads.

Also as a HUGE note, if you see "League of Legends" actually in a champion's bio, then you're seeing one other problem; with the change in writing and direction they also removed the League of Legends from the universe itself, so the organisation called the Institute of War that ran the League of Legends in the League universe ain't a thing anymore. What you can basically take away from this is the following:

- Everything released from and including Darius to now is totally canon and totally what it's supposed to be.
- If a champ has lore that has a line like "and then they went and joined the League" almost like a footnote at the end, you can remove that line and it should be fine. There might be some changes to these guys in the future but for now it should be ok. A prime example is {{champion:115}}.
- {{champion:9}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:25}}{{champion:56}}  {{champion:111}} {{champion:61}}{{champion:44}}  are in a weird situation where their lore hasn't been updated for this change, yet they're kinda intrinsically tied to the League even though it doesn't exist, making them exist in a weird limbo. Some of them (Nautilus and Orianna) aren't in as bad a spot because of the nature of their stories, but suffice to say their lore's a bit iffy and you might want to avoid diving in to that for a while if you're get invested in stuff.

Sorry for the info dump but from what I gathered from your post I figured getting this stuff out of the way right now would be best. Hopefully this made some kind of sense, if not I'll figure out a better way of putting it.

> The paragraph you're seeing there is meant to be a brief summary, not a biography.

Sharjo, thank's for pointing this out. I really want to highlight this - we've been using these short summaries in the client since Azir. These go out with the champ when they go to PBE, much like other champion game/client assets.

But we have ALSO released longer-form stories outside of the client, generally around the time of the champion's release:

{{champion:268}} : [Arisen](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/zmvrQ7I6-short-stories-azirarisen) | [Shurima Event Storyline](http://promo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/shurima/story/index.html)
{{champion:429}} : [Invocation](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/UTTHinkA-short-stories-kalista-invocation) | [The Pledge](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GnT8jVCyh_E)
{{champion:421}} : [Scourge of the Desert](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/creative-spotlight/reksai-scourge-desert)
{{champion:432}} : [Mountain](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CX8iSobsKTY)

This also happened with Braum, along with his longer in-client bio: [The Feats of Braum](http://promo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/braum/)

I get that there are mixed feelings on this approach, and differing opinions on how successful these kinds of stories are. Those are fine and valuable discussions to have, and I don't want to downplay those feelings at all. But the fact remains that while we're only putting short bios in the client, we have still been releasing other story components for the champion.

Ekko was announced just this week, and has NOT been officially released yet. It is too early to claim that this is all he's getting, so can we please lower the pitchforks until Ekko actually releases, and THEN assess the quality of his lore?

You are quite brazen to come in here and wave the flag of "How dare you assess the quality of lore until it's finalized!" when for 9 months, since the announcement of the retcon, we still don't have a fully fleshed-out world.

Do you think we are a meek fanbase to be trampled over because you feel we're too harsh on lore that's not-yet-released? Look at YOUR ENTIRE WORLD right now. 90%+ of it IS NO LONGER CANON!

There are problems with the reaction. There are problems with the harsh nature of how we react to anything currently released. [But the true issue lies in Riot refusing to interact with their community](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/bvhOElyf-narrative-this-is-truly-disheartening), and further perpetuating the continuous negative response to any lore released today. The problem is cyclical, but the community can't force Riot to interact with us, ergo it is Riot's responsibility to stop the cycle.

Riot ShadowStorm I am severely disappointed with the tone you brought to the discussion. Shame on you for talking down to us as if we are overreacting to something Riot has not systematically disappointed us with.

Additionally, you will note that in my posts about lore I have never, and I emphasize that vehemently: I have NEVER proposed to speak for everyone. But feel free to straw man away if it so pleases you.

At the end of the day, we can only voice our opinions, and it is Riot who will make the ultimate decision. When they make those decisions, and produce content, we have a basic right to disagree publicly and as loudly as we want.

The Shurima event storyline was boring and had a very boring medium. Arisen was great but not really officially released, just put on the forums.
Kalistas invocation/pledge told nothing more than the short summary.
Scourge of the Desert was about Shurima and Noxus.
Mountain wasn't much really, given that we have no context to put it in.
The feats of Braum is a nice piece of character building.

I'm not blaming people for assuming this is basically all the lore we're gonna get for Ekko, only Azir and Sion really had more lore than their short bio. Perhaps we'll get it twice or thrice like with Kalista.

(Well, there's also Xeraths modus operandi and main motivation getting changed when Azirs story got released, which isn't helping things much from my perspective. On top of that, the first post-retcon event, Freljord, being all build-up and no conclusion where Trundle got removed and replaced.)

I'm pessimistic about Riots lore and I do believe I have solid reasoning. I'm not going to be excited about upcoming lore. You'll probably just tell us the same shallow character, and (more importantly for me personally) perhaps taking another old champion and changing/replacing it to fit in the new characters lore.

***

Regardless of it all, it's fair to wait for his official release before judging once again.

Right, I should clarify - I'm only trying to point out the fact that those pieces exist. Whether they're good enough is a separate discussion entirely. It just feels really premature to me to say that Ekko's lore is lacking, and to get really angry about it, when we haven't even released him yet.

And if we're not to give feedback for lore until it is totally finalized and fully released, how are we ever to convey to Riot that we believe they're going in a wrong direction?

Riot ShadowStorm, you're fighting a cause of "don't judge a book by it's cover" but right now we're already several pages into the book. The book being a metaphor for Riot's recent lore releases, and before we even turn the page (Ekko's full lore release) we're not really happy with the direction it is going.

It isn't premature. It is long overdue.

Past behavior is an indicator of future patterns.  We didn't get much actual content from the recently released champs (Gnar's story was the last one, iirc), so it's safe to assume we're not getting much more out of Ekko.

You can say it's premature, but unless we're getting an unprecedented lore blitz the size of Mt. Targon about Ekko, it's safe to assume that it's not.

> Past behavior is an indicator of future patterns.

Sure, that's fair to say. But for an example of where I'm coming from on this... you said earlier that Rek'Sai's piece was something people praised, because (in your words):

> it told a story about Rek'Sai (you know, what Narrative is supposed to be doing with these champions?)

That piece was released on December 10 (the day before Rek'Sai was released) - **25 days after Rek'Sai's announcement**. I don't think it would've been fair to judge the quality of Rek'Sai's lore without that piece. Maybe people still think it sucks, but at least they think that based on the full thing.

I'm just asking that we do the same for Ekko. Since past behavior is an indicator of a future patterns, there's a good chance something else will be released. Maybe he gets a piece that sucks. Maybe it's amazing. Maybe it's amazing, but answers no questions, and thus people think it was pointless. Maybe he gets nothing at all and I look like a total fool.

I won't predict or promise anything, other than to say that once he's released, I will come back and jump into Ekko lore threads - even if the feelings are still negative.

Out of context, Rek'Sai's supplementary lore was amazing.  It also came off the heels of Sion's reworked story (which was mistakenly added to the client instead of the short story that should have been placed there).

Now, to put her lore release in context:

1.  For those 25 days, we were waiting for some additional context from Narrative, something beyond that "The Terror Beneath" cartoon that was released on November 24.
2.  We were still three months off the still controversial Retcon announcement (which removed with nothing to show but empty promises, undeserved requests for patience and time and the barest acknowledgment that Narrative screwed up their relationship with their fans.
3.  The Narrative lead at the time, Tom "TommyGnox" Abernathy, leaving Riot for dubious reasons when he was less than willing to follow up on promises to communicate.
4.  A Narrative writer giving a very inappropriate joke about the recently released Shurima short bios and the unfortunate backlash that led to her getting death threats from some very evil people.
5.  Years of silence and neglect from the various Narrative teams since the Karma Rework and the removal of the Journal of Justice and League Judgments, followed by lies about communicating more, empty apologies and no real content to show for it.
6.  Freljord.  (Enough said, right?)
7.  The removal of 15 full champion bios (Shurima and Shadow Isles) with no timeline of when they would be replaced or revealed.

And with all that baggage Riot and Narrative heaped upon this long neglected, poorly treated fanbase (and that's just the surface of what Riot's done to this group of fans)...  there was still some acknowledgement from most people here that Rek'Sai and Sion were _really good_.

Two successes out of all that abuse?  That's not much to hang on your wall, as it were.

> I won't predict or promise anything, other than to say that once he's released, I will come back and jump into Ekko lore threads - even if the feelings are still negative.

To do what, _exactly?_

If Ekko's lore is as good as Rek'Sai, or merely better than Bard's, are you going to come here and say "_See, I told you guys to wait!_"  We get abused enough with Narrative's silence and Riot's overall disdain for their lore fans.  It wouldn't help if you came in with attitude of smugness, whether you intended it or not.

And if Ekko's story is not good?  Are you really going to take time out of your day to dive into already hostile territory, knowing you're going to get dunked into this cesspool of brutality and frustration that your employers created?
I don't need anything anymore; at this point I'd be happy if they actually canoned everything, removed all the lores, and started from scratch. Champion by champion.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot ShadowStorm,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Ql5gi7Ah,comment-id=000000060004000000010000,timestamp=2015-05-17T03:01:41.667+0000)
I don't think it would've been fair to judge the quality of Rek'Sai's lore without that piece. Maybe people still think it sucks, but at least they think that based on the full thing.

Full thing? I had no idea that a Rek'Sai story even existed...you know what I want? I want to be able to pop open my client, go to a champions' page, click "lore" and actually read some freakin' lore...not just a short description of the champion. Forcing me to track down a character's lore somewhere out on the interwebs is no bueno. 

Seriously, you guys are starting to remind me of Blizzard in that Blizz has a really bad habit of hiding important lore points in media that lies OUTSIDE OF THE GAME. People hate that. If you're going to write a goddamn story about a champion then copy/paste that shit into the client or at least provide a link like "Read more about Rek'Sai here!" This isn't rocket science.

Oh no. As much as I criticize Blizzard on things, at least when they put lore in outside sources, you get actual lore. To the point where I feel like they're justified in doing what they do. This is honestly one of the worst handlings of lore I've seen.

Heyo, I know that you're not on the lore team, unless lore got changed to be something technical that needs to be coordinated, but I do appreciate you dropping by and just trying to diffuse the situation. I completely understand where both parties are coming from (I very much enjoy the lore... well, the lore that there is) but I also understand that a retcon is a massive project, but to be fair, it HAS been a while. 

I feel that a lot of people forget that Rioters posting to the forums is done by their own initiative, and they think that the Reds are just posting to try to make an excuse so they get flustered, hateful, etc. This thread isn't super bad, yet, but there are definitely some people who are very accusatory. This seems to happen whenever a Red posts as you'll see something such as a Red participating in a forum game, and then there'll be a thread about it hating on Reds for posting on forum games instead of say, doing lore or fixing that broke ass shit zed, but they don't take a step back and realize that LITERALLY everyone on these forums is a human, and that includes Reds, and sometimes they just want to jump on the forums to relax and they obviously don't work 24/7. This constant negative attitude causes, at least I feel that it would cause, a lot of Reds who want to join in the community but don't because of the backlash it can cause, and that makes me sad. I really wish that people would take a step back, and realize that just because a Red posts on something, doesn't make it THEIR fault or mean that they are not doing their jobs. They are standing at the bottom of the castle with pitchforks, knives, torches, and other weapons, and then they wonder why the Reds won't come down to 'talk' with them.

As it's been said multiple times in this thread, past actions predict future patterns. That's exactly why the Reds don't post more often, for each time they do on a controversial subject they get constant flak. If you put your hand on a hot stovetop and burned yourself, would you touch it again unless you KNEW it had cooled down?

tl;dr People keep using a pitchfork metaphor, but do you know what the 'put your pitchforks down' statement is regarding? It's a statement referring to mobs and their pitchforks and torches, which means saying that you will put down your pitchforks when stuff gets done is you guys admitting that you are just going along with a mob mentality, and that gets violent, hateful, and lacks logic. So please, for the sake of everyone here, can we actually escape the mob mentality please??
